question: Okay, what are the types of food that people eat in your country?
transcript: In my country, people really like to eat hot soup with rice because usually Koreans are very busy, so they have to cut off the time even, even if, even the mealtime, during the mealtime. So if you just mix the rice with the soup, you do not have to chew it, and so you can decrease the amount of time that you spend on your meal.

anti_overrating.reason: 'cut off the time' (cut down on time / save time).

question: Balanced diet?
transcript: I think balanced diet is just eat various types of carbohydrates and fatty acids and proteins as much as possible. Okay how are the eating habits in your country different from eating habits in the past It was not that different but only difference is that people usually do not eat rice than before because there is a lot of globalizations already occurred So we know there is a lot of tasty food without rice, but at the past we always eat food with rice. So we called the Korean terminology meal as rice, same as rice.

question: Would you like to start?
transcript: So as a, as a person, I am a very punctual, but whenever I have any kind of occasions or class, I try to go out prior of the time, but sometimes my luck does not favors me. So for that reason, I become late in most of the time. at one time I faced, late, in my sister's marriage, my sister's marriage occasion, and it was being held outskirts of the city. As I was outside of the city, I, my place was very far away from the marriage occasion. So I had to take a bus to reach the place. But there was not any kind of airport or train station available in the near of the establishment where her marriage was being held. So I had to take a bus and the bus literally came to the bus station after half an hour. So already I was late. After that, when I was one hour far away from the establishment where the marriage was being held, There was so much traffic congestion that the bus couldn even move At that time my parents were calling me where I was what I was doing I called them and explained that I very frustrated right now as I in a very hard traffic jam I can get out of it And they were very sad to hear it And I told them that you have to continue the marriage without me Then they continued the marriage When I reached the place the relatives especially the in of my sister they were very sad because I couldn attend the Nika the traditional marriage which held in our country

anti_overrating.reason: 'I am a very punctual' (I am very punctual). 'prior of the time' (prior to the time). 'luck does not favors me' (favor). 'held outskirts' (held on the outskirts). 'in the near of' (near / in the vicinity of). 'I very frustrated' (I was very frustrated). 'as I in' (as I was in).

question: The first question is, why do we have rules in society?
transcript: rules, in my opinion, rules is very essential for our society. Without rules, there will be fighting and war going on among the people. anti_overrating.reason: 'rules is very essential' (rules are). 'For the rules' (Because of the rules). 'in peace, peaceful' (peacefully). 'As there is rule exists' (As rules exist). 'fairness is available' (fairness).

question: Do you think it is necessary to set up rules about overworking people?
transcript: I think it is essential for overworking people to set up some kind of rules for them. In this competitive working zone, people are being too much of archiholic nowadays. For that, they are facing burnouts, being stressed too much, and they are also having many health issues. If their proper rules are established for just like limitations of working hours and how many times they can work, they can, they can easily avoid those health, hazards.

anti_overrating.reason: 'archiholic' (workaholic). 'competitive working zone' (environment). 'limitations of working hours' (limits on).

question: What are some examples of rules that exist in many families?
transcript: there are two primary rules I can tell from my experience one rule is that coming home before 8 8 PM It is a very essential rule of every family because if parents don give children the rule of coming home early the children easily can get spoiled and they tend to stay late at night outside And another rule is that I am going to talk about is that, eating together with family in a dining room. Because after eating together in a, in a dining room with the family, it helps us to bond more and talk about what we have done all throughout the day with our family members. It helps to create a more strong bond.
